definition: to shake/to vibrate/to jolt/to quake/excited/shocked/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing thunder/☳
to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
variant of 燙|烫[tang4]/variant of 趟[tang4]

sentences.english: He was caught by an avalanche and was seriously concussed.
sentences.chinese: 他碰到雪崩，受到严重的脑震荡。

sentences.english: Symptoms of cerebral edema mirror other brain conditions such as tumors and concussions.
sentences.chinese: 脑水肿可诱发其他大脑疾病，如脑肿瘤和脑震荡。

sentences.english: When I got home, I told my brother I thought I might have a concussion.
sentences.chinese: 回家之后我对老哥说自己可能有点脑震荡。

sentences.english: If this is a concussion, why is it taking so long?
sentences.chinese: 如果只是脑震荡，干嘛要花这么长时间诊断？

sentences.english: Methods An animal model of concussive brain injury in rats was duplicated with a metallic pendulum-striker concussive device.
sentences.chinese: 方法用金属单摆打击装置复制大鼠单纯性脑震荡模型。

sentences.english: A concussion is an injury that happens when the brain is shaking inside the scow .
sentences.chinese: 脑震荡是一种发生在头骨内部的大脑的震动。

sentences.english: Voigt suffered a fractured right cheekbone and a severe concussion.
sentences.chinese: 福格特被打断右颧骨严重脑震荡。

sentences.english: Some concussions are more severe than others.
sentences.chinese: 某些脑震荡后果较常规更为严重。

sentences.english: At the hospital they told him he had a concussion, and to get some rest.
sentences.chinese: 在医院，医生告诉他，他得了脑震荡，需要休息。

definition: to suffer a fracture/(of a bone) to break/fracture
to sustain injuries/wounded (in an accident etc)/harmed
to abrade/to scrape/to chafe/to graze/abrasion/friction burn/scratch
